tweet: The #NCA4 found that, globally, 16 of the last 17 years are the warmest on record. It’s past time for Congress to #ActOnClimate to protect the health of our people and future of our planet. #ClimateFriday pic.twitter.com/2LUQEvK5dJ

Glad that Congress acted to ensure the National Flood Insurance Program does not lapse, but a one week stopgap is not enough. We need a long-term extension to protect homeowners. https://news.bloombergenvironment.com/environment-and-energy/congress-gives-flood-insurance-a-short-term-extension …

It would also ensure public notification for any violations so local communities have the facts about the safety of their air. I appreciate the leadership of @DickDurbin & support of my colleagues on this legislation. This is about our public health, and we need action now.

The @EPA needs to take all appropriate and necessary actions to protect our communities from the threat of ethylene oxide – a known carcinogen. Our bill would require EPA to end the delay and update emission standards based on the science. https://schneider.house.gov/media/press-releases/schneider-and-durbin-introduce-bill-require-epa-revise-standards-ethylene-oxide …

We must also ensure EPA’s regulations reflect the most up-to-date research and public health data on the dangers of ethylene oxide and other industrial chemicals.

Additionally, the EPA needs to take steps to embrace transparency by making all test data publicly available and holding a public meeting so residents have confidence in the safety of their community.

Every family deserves safe breathing air, and we need enforceable environmental standards to guarantee our public health.
